galaxy_dive.analyze_data.generic_data module¶

Class for analyzing simulation data.

@author: Zach Hafen @contact: zachary.h.hafen@gmail.com @status: Development

class galaxy_dive.analyze_data.generic_data.DataKeyParser[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for parsing data_keys provided to SimulationData.

is_fraction_key(data_key)[source]¶

Check if the data should be some fraction of its relevant scale.

Args:
data_key (str) : Data key to check.
Returns:
is_fraction_key (bool) : True if the data should be scaled as a fraction of the relevant scale.
is_log_key(data_key)[source]¶

Check if the data key indicates the data should be put in log scale.

Args:
data_key (str) : Data key to check.
Returns:
is_log_key (bool) : True if the data should be taken log10 of
is_position_key(data_key)[source]¶

Checks if the data key deals with position primarily.

Args:
data_key (str) : Data key to check.
Returns:
is_position_key (bool) : True if deals with position.
is_velocity_key(data_key)[source]¶

Checks if the data key deals with velocity primarily.

Args:
data_key (str) : Data key to check.
Returns:
is_velocity_key (bool) : True if deals with velocity.
class galaxy_dive.analyze_data.generic_data.DataMasker(data_object)[source]¶

Bases: object

clear_masks(clear_optional_masks=False)[source]¶

Reset the masks in total to nothing.

Modifies:
self.masks (lists) : Sets to empty
get_masked_data(data_key, mask='total', optional_masks=None, sl=None, apply_slice_to_mask=True, fix_invalid=False, compress=True, mask_multidim_data=True, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get all the data that doesn’t have some sort of mask applied to it. Use the processed data.

Args:
data_key (str) : Data key to get the data for. mask (str or np.array of bools) : Mask to apply. If none, use the total mask. optional_masks (list-like) : List of names of optional masks to use (must be found in self.optional_masks). sl (slice) : Slice to apply to the data apply_slice_to_mask (bool) : Whether or not to apply the same slice you applied to the data to the mask. fix_invalid (bool) : Whether or not to also mask invalid data. compress (bool) : Whether or not to return compressed data. mask_multidim_data (bool) : Whether or not to change the mask to fit multidimensional data. *args, **kwargs : Passed to get_proceesed_data.
Returns:
data_ma (np.array) : Compressed masked data. Because it’s compressed it may not have the same shape as the
original data.
get_total_mask(optional_masks=None)[source]¶

Get the result of combining all masks in the data.

Args:
optional_masks (list-like) : List of names of optional masks to use (must be found in self.optional_masks).
Returns:
total_mask (np.array of bools) : Result of all masks.
mask_data(data_key, data_min=<object object>, data_max=<object object>, data_value=<object object>, custom_mask=<object object>, return_or_store='store', optional_mask=False, mask_name=<object object>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get only the particle data within a certain range. Note that it retrieves the processed data.

Args:
data_key (str) :
Data key to base the mask off of.
data_min (float) :
Everything below data_min will be masked.
data_max (float) :
Everything above data_max will be masked.
data_value (float) :
Everything except for data_value will be masked.
custom_mask (bool) :
If provided, take in a custom mask instead, using data_key as the label for the mask.
return_or_store (str) :
Whether to store the mask as part of the masks dictionary, or to return it.
optional_mask (bool) :
If True, store in the dictionary self.optional_masks instead.
mask_name (str) :
What name to associate with this mask? Currently only relevant if optional_mask is True. By default uses the data_key as the name.
*args, **kwargs :
Passed to self.data_object.get_processed_data()
Returns:
data_mask (np.array of bools) :
If requested, the mask for data in that range.
Modifies:
self.masks (list of dicts) :
Appends a dictionary describing the mask.
class galaxy_dive.analyze_data.generic_data.GenericData(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Very generic data class, with getting and masking functionality.

base_data_shape¶

Property for simulation redshift.

get_data(data_key, sl=None, data_storage=<object object>)[source]¶

Get the data from within the class. Only for getting the data. No post-processing or changing the data (putting it in particular units, etc.) The idea is to calculate necessary quantities as the need arises, hence a whole function for getting the data.

Args:
data_key (str) : Key in the data dictionary for the key we want to get sl (slice) : Slice of the data, if requested.
Returns:
data (np.ndarray) : Requested data.
get_masked_data(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Wrapper for getting masked data.

get_processed_data(data_key, data_method=<object object>, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Get post-processed data. (Accounting for fractions, log-space, etc.).

Args:
data_key (str) : What data to get. data_method (str) : What method to use for getting the data itself. Defaults to using self.get_data *args, **kwargs : Passed to get_data()
Returns:
processed_data (np.ndarray) : Requested data, including formatting.
handle_data_key_error(data_key)[source]¶

Method for attempting to generate data on the fly.

Args:
data_key (str) : Type of data to attempt to generate data for.
iterate_over_method(method_str, iter_arg, iter_values, method_args)[source]¶

Iterate over a specified method, and get the results out.

Args:
method_str (str) :
Which method to use.
iter_arg (str) :
Which argument of the method to iterate over.
iter_values (list of values) :
Which values to change.
method_args (dict) :
Default args to pass to the method
Returns:
results (list) : [ method( **used_args ) for used_args in all_variations_of_used_args ]
length_scale¶

Property for fiducial length scale. By default, is 1. However, a more advanced subclass might set this differently, or this might change in the future.

mask_data(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Wrapper for masking data.

metallicity_scale¶

Property for fiducial metallicity scale. By default is z_sun However, a more advanced subclass might set this differently, or this might change in the future.

shift(data, data_key)[source]¶

Shift or multiply the data by some amount. Note that this is applied after logarithms are applied.

data : data to be shifted data_key : Data key for the parameters to be shifted Parameters are a subdictionary of self.kwargs ‘data_key’ : What data key the data is shifted for

velocity_scale¶

Property for fiducial velocity scale. By default is 1. However, a more advanced subclass might set this differently, or this might change in the future.
